Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Limestone Eagle Statue
Description: The limestone statue depicts an eagle stretching its wings and standing on a base. The base is broken from the right side and the beak is also broken. The eyes are circularly lined. There are traces of a grey color on the head and wings. The feathers are portrayed in various shapes. They take vertical lines on the inner side of the wing and round shapes on the other sides of the wing, as well as on the chest. Other carved lines decorate the head.The tail of the figure rests on the base and is visible from behind the legs. The eagle was the symbol of the spirit and stood for the Roman Empire
